summary:
Headline:
Netflix delivered a solid Q2 with 12% revenue growth year-over-year, driven by subscriber gains and higher ARPU, while operating margin improved by 150 basis points.

Growth & revenue drivers:
- Revenue increased 12% YoY.
- Growth fueled by steady subscriber additions and increased average revenue per user (ARPU).
- Content spend rose modestly but remains focused on disciplined returns.

Margins / profitability:
- Operating margin expanded by 150 basis points.
- Improvement attributed to normalization of content amortization.

Guidance & outlook:
- Raised full-year revenue growth guidance to low-teens percentage.
- Operating margin expected at the high end of the previously communicated range.

Risks / watchpoints:
- No specific risks mentioned in the remarks.
- Continued discipline on content investment critical to sustaining margin expansion.
